comments.body:
(following up from the other PR:)

Huh. Do we know how Windows developers feel about this? It seems surprising that we wouldn't use platform conventions in filenames in our stack traces.

cc @goderbauer
Note that when packages are involved Dart VM used to report errors like this `package:a\b\c` on Windows which is super confusing because `package` paths are supposed to be uris which use `/` not `\`.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +67,71 @@      'The following assertion was thrown testing the error handling logic:\n'
      'Message goes here\\.\n'
      '\'[^\']+flutter/test/foundation/error_reporting_test\\.dart\': Failed assertion: line [0-9]+ pos [0-9]+: \'false\'\n'
      '\n'
      'Either the assertion indicates an error in the framework itself, or we should provide substantially '
